result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARGARET S OLSON

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant MARGARET S OLSON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARGARET S OLSON.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis requests a Jury Trial be scheduled. Court sets for Status Hearing on December 13, 2022 at 10:00 AM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before. ADA McElroy advises the offer is off the table.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant MARGARET S OLSON in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARGARET S OLSON.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states they are not ready to proceed today and requests another court date. Court sets for Plea & sentencing on november 1, 2022 at 3:45 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial Status Report
E.O.

8:37 AM Defendant MARGARET S OLSON in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for MARGARET S OLSON. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is requesting the prelim to proceed. DA Laspisa states she has one witness.

Jessica Schroeder sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed as an officer by the City of Green Lake Police Department, was previously employed for the City of Berlin Police Department. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Venue established. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Kapelis. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Kapelis. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 8:48 AM
Return date scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant MARGARET S OLSON appeared in court, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for MARGARET S OLSON, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Kapelis - Defendant requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled.  Court schedules Prelim for April 12, 2022 at 8:30 AM. 1/2 hour. Atty Kapelis requests to address bond. Court instructs Atty Kapelis to file a motion.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Michael Kapelis

2:36 PM Defendant MARGARET S OLSON appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant, do not have an attorney yet, they are still working on it. Court goes over time limits. Defendant wants an attorney. Court takes that as a time limit waiver. Court sets for Status of Counsel on February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned at 2:38 PM
Second appearance scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The defendant phoned the office and asked about this afternoon's court appearance, stating she has to work later this afternoon and hoping she would be finished with her hearing fairly quickly. I told her I could pass this along to the Court and see whether it was possible for her to go first in her time slot. Defendant stated that she had spoken with the PD's office and that she was waiting for an attorney to be appointed.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Def is to have no unsupervised contact with any minors except her own children.
Preliminary hearing on February 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Def is to have no unsupervised contact with any minors except her own children.

9:48 AM Defendant MARGARET S HOEFFLER appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def also known as Margaret Olson - clerk to amend criminal complaint with updated last name of Olson. Defendant is eligible for the public defender. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. No unsupervised contact with any minors except her own children. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Prelim Feb 01, 2022 at 2:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 9:51 AM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
